openconnector.rest

Class RestApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • openconnector.rest.RestApi
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class RestApi
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

    This is main interface to the Rest API.

    Provides CRUD and query operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestApi

        public RestApi(java.net.URI server,
               java.lang.String userName,
               java.lang.String password,
               java.lang.String apiVersion,
               java.lang.String contextURL,
               java.util.List<org.apache.http.Header> headers)
        Creates a new instance for the specified server using the specified credentials.
        Parameters:
        server - The server to connect to, e.g. new URI("https://rally1.rallydev.com")
        userName - The username to be used for authentication.
        password - The password to be used for authentication.
        apiVersion - version of REST API
        contextURL - context path for accessing REST end point.
        headers - list of headers to pass to target system.

      • RestApi

        public RestApi(java.net.URI server,
               java.lang.String userName,
               java.lang.String password,
               java.lang.String apiVersion,
               java.lang.String contextURL,
               java.util.List<org.apache.http.Header> headers,
               int connectionTimeout)
        Creates a new instance for the specified server using the specified credentials.
        Parameters:
        server - The server to connect to, e.g. new URI("https://rally1.rallydev.com")
        userName - The username to be used for authentication.
        password - The password to be used for authentication.
        apiVersion - version of REST API
        contextURL - context path for accessing REST end point.
        headers - list of headers to pass to target system.
        connectionTimeout - time taken to terminate connection if response not received.

        Parameters:

        userName - The username to be used for authentication.
        password - The password to be used for authentication.

                                   java.lang.String proxyport,
                                   java.lang.String proxyUserName,
                                   java.lang.String proxyPassword)
        Set proxy user name and password in the request.
        Parameters:
        proxyhost - The proxy server, e.g. new URI("http://my.proxy.com:8000")
        proxyport - The proxy port
        proxyUserName - The proxy username to be used for authentication.
        proxyPassword - The proxy password to be used for authentication.

      • buildWsapiUrl

        public java.lang.String buildWsapiUrl()
        Gets base url based on the current server and REST API version
        Returns:
        the fully qualified WSAPI base url, e.g. https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/1.33 or http://sailpoint-compass.uat5.hosted.jivesoftware.com/api/core/v3/people?startIndex=0&count=100&sort=lastNameAsc
